page_analysis.text_content:
Below-grade patios standards
& site planning

• Such features may not be located on the side of the struc-
ture that faces the front yard.
• Combined area of all such areas not to exceed 2% of
the area of the lot or 200 sf, whichever is greater and
no single area may exceed 200 sf. Note area devoted to
required stairway egress shall not be included in the 200
sf limitation.
• Each such area is separated from another by at least 10'.
• Allowable encroachment into required side yard is 2'
max.
• Allowable encroachment into required rear yard is 4'.
• The combined length of all the excavated features or por-
tions of features that encroach into the required yards, on
all sides of the structure, may not exceed 15'.
• Excavated features shall not be harmful to neighboring
trees.
• Public Works Department must approve drainage system.
• Overhangs or canopies installed to shelter such area shall
count towards lot coverage.
• Such areas to be architecturally compatible with resi-
dence.
• Such areas to be screened to off site views by means of
landscaping and/or fencing as determined appropriate by
Planning Dept.

Fig 40 Examples of site plan w/below-grade patios

Below-grade patios
Front yard

• a + b (encroaching features) may not exceed 15'
• No single below-grade patio may not exceed 200 sf

Interior-side yard

• Combined areas of all below-grade patio areas may not
exceed 2% of the lot area or 200 sf, which ever is greater
Note: measurments are based on interior dimension of
opening and exclude encasing structure.

43

visual_elements.description: Figure 40: Examples of site plan with below-grade patios. The diagram shows a property layout with a 'Main dwelling' and a '2nd dwelling'. It illustrates various elements like 'Front yard', 'Rear yard', 'Interior-side yard', 'Interior lot example', 'Landscape screening', and 'Required setbacks' (dashed lines). It highlights 'length of encroachment' for 'a' and 'b' features, with specific maximum encroachment values (4' max. encroachment for rear yard, 2' max. encroachment for side yard). A '10' min. separation' is shown between the 'Main dwelling' and '2nd dwelling'. The diagram includes shaded areas representing 'Buildable area', 'Dwelling', 'Lightwells & stairwells' (solid black), and 'Lightwells & stairwells that encroach into the required yards' (striped). Landscaping screening is depicted by wavy lines with small circles. A key is provided for all these elements.
visual_elements.location: Top right and middle right of the page

visual_elements.description: A legend for the 'Fig 40' diagram, defining symbols for: Curb (thick line), Lot line (thin line), Sidewalk (patterned block), Required setbacks (dashed line), Buildable area (light grey fill), Dwelling (medium grey fill), Lightwells & stairwells (solid black fill), Lightwells & stairwells that encroach into the required yards (striped fill), and Landscaping screening (wavy line with circles).
visual_elements.location: Middle left, below the main text

execution_sequence.action: Evaluate combined area of all such areas.
Exclude stairway egress area from limitation.
Evaluate allowable encroachment into required side yard.
Evaluate allowable encroachment into required rear yard.
Evaluate combined length of excavated features encroachment.
Evaluate potential harm to neighboring trees.
Obtain Public Works Department approval for drainage system.
Determine if overhangs or canopies count towards lot coverage.
Evaluate maximum length of 'a + b' encroaching features.
Evaluate maximum area of a single below-grade patio.
Evaluate combined area of all below-grade patio areas.
